file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-40-05-04 - NACELLE AND PYLON - ACCESS DOOR/PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NACELLE AND PYLON - ACCESS DOOR/PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Nacelles and Pylons access doors/ panels. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 52-40-05-000-801-A NACELLES ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL NACELLE ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLA- ALL 52-40-05-400-801-A TION ALL 52-40-05-000-802-A PYLON ACCESS PANELS- REMOVAL PYLON ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLA- ALL 52-40-05-400-802-A TION THRUST REVERSE ACCESS PANELS- ALL 52-40-05-000-803-A REMOVAL THRUST REVERSE ACCESS PANELS - ALL 52-40-05-400-803-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-40-05 Page 1 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-40-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NACELLES ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the nacelle access panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 411 411AT Nacelle 412 412AT Nacelle 412 412BT Nacelle 412 412CL Nacelle 412 412DL Nacelle 421 421AT Nacelle 422 422AT Nacelle 422 422BT Nacelle 422 422CR Nacelle 422 422DR Nacelle D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nacelle EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-40-05 Page 2 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Identify the Nacelle access panels 411AT, 412AT, 412BT, 412CL, 412DL, 421AT, 422AT, 422BT, 422CR, and 422DR. Refer to AMM MPP 06-43-00/100. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Put the workstand in the work area. (2) Remove the screws (2) that attach access panel (1). (3) Remove the access panel (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-40-05 Page 3 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Nacelle Access Panels - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B B A ZONES 411/412 421/422 DET. A (TYPICAL) 1 1. ACCESS PANEL 2. SCREWS DET. B (TYPICAL) 1 AERODYNAMIC LIMITS 145AMM520602.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-40-05 Page 4 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-40-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. NACELLE ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the nacelle access panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES SRM 51-10-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 411 411AT Nacelle 412 412AT Nacelle 412 412BT Nacelle 412 412CL Nacelle 412 412DL Nacelle 421 421AT Nacelle 422 422AT Nacelle 422 422BT Nacelle 422 422CR Nacelle 422 422DR Nacelle D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the attachment screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-40-05 Page 5 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nacelle I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the access panel (1). (2) Install the screws (2) that attach the access panel (1) applying the correct torque. Refer to AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (3) Remove the workstand from the work area. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Check the Aerodynamic Limits. Refer to SRM 51-10-01. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-40-05 Page 6 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 52-40-05 Page 7 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Pylon I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Identify the Pylon access panels 414AB, 414BB, 414CB, 414DB, 414EB, 414FT, 414GT, 424AB, 424BB, 424CB, 424DB, 424EB, 424FT, and 424GT. Refer to AMM MPP 06-43-00/100. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Put the workstand in the work area. (2) Remove the screws (2) that attach access panel (1). (3) Remove the access panel (1). Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the access panel (1). (2) Install the screws (2) that attach the access panel (1) applying the correct torque. Refer to AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (3) Remove the workstand from the work area. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Check the Aerodynamic Limits. Refer to SRM 51-10-01. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Thrust Reverse I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Identify the Thrust Reverse access panels 416AB, 416BB, 416CB, 416DB, 416EB, 416FB, 416GB, 416HT, 416IZ, 416JT, 416KT, 416LT, 416MT, 416NT, 416PR, 416QL, 416RR, 416SL, 416TR, 416UL, 416VZ, 416XZ, 416WZ, 416YZ, 416ZZ, 426AB, 426BB, 426CB, 426DB, 426EB, 426FB, 426GB, 426HT, 426JT, 426KT, 426LT, 426MT, 426NT, 426PR, 426IZ, 426QL, 426RR, 426SL, 426TR, 426UL, 426VZ, 426XZ, 426WZ, 426YZ, and 426ZZ. Refer to AMM MPP 06-42-00/100. J. Removal (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Put the workstand in the work area. (2) Remove the screws (2) that attach access panel (1). (3) Remove the access panel (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 52-40-05 Page 14 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
